dict.string: Configures Privacy Preferences Policy Control settings
The human-readable description of this payload. This description appears on the Detail screen.
The human-readable name for the profile payload. The name appears on the Detail screen and doesn't need to be unique.

The reverse-DNS-style identifier for the payload. This identifier is usually the same as the TopLevel value, with an additional appended component. This string must be unique within the profile. During a profile replacement, the system updates payloads with the same 'PayloadIdentifier' and 'PayloadUUID' in the old and new profiles.
The payload type, which each payload domain's reference page specifies.

The globally unique identifier for the payload. The actual content is unimportant, but must be globally unique. In macOS, use 'uuidgen' to generate UUIDs. During a profile replacement, the system updates payloads with the same 'PayloadIdentifier' and 'PayloadUUID' in the old and new profiles.
The version of this specific payload.
The human-readable string containing the name of the organization that provides the profile. This value doesn't need to match the organization payload value in the enclosing dictionary.
A dictionary whose keys are limited to the privacy policy control services. In the case of conflicting specifications, the most restrictive setting (deny) is used.
Specifies the policies for the app via the Accessibility subsystem.

Keys are limited to the privacy service names listed below. Each key is an array of dictionaries describing the app or process to which access is given. In the case of conflicting specifications, the most restrictive setting (deny) will be used.
The bundle ID or installation path of the binary.
The designated requirement describing the code signature of this executable.
If set to true, statically validate the code requirement. Used only if the process invalidates its dynamic code signature.
If set to true, access is granted. Otherwise the process does not have access. The user is not prompted and cannot change this value.
Specifies the policies for the app sending restricted AppleEvents to another process.

Keys are limited to the privacy service names listed below. Each key is an array of dictionaries describing the app or process to which access is given. In the case of conflicting specifications, the most restrictive setting (deny) will be used.
The bundle ID or installation path of the binary.
The designated requirement describing the code signature of this executable.
If set to true, statically validate the code requirement. Used only if the process invalidates its dynamic code signature.
If set to true, access is granted. Otherwise the process does not have access. The user is not prompted and cannot change this value.
The identifier of the process receiving an ApplEvent sent by the Identifier process.
Code requirement for the receiving binary.

If set to true, access is granted. Otherwise the process does not have access. The user is not prompted and cannot change this value.

The bundle ID or installation path of the binary.

The type of identifier value. Application bundles must be identified by bundle ID. Nonbundled binaries must be identified by installation path. Helper tools embedded within an application bundle automatically inherit the permissions of their enclosing app bundle.
If 'true', statically validate the code requirement. Used only if the process invalidates its dynamic code signature.
If 'true', access is granted; otherwise, the process doesn't have access. The user isn't prompted and can't change this value.

The 'Authorization' key is an optional replacement for the 'Allowed' key. Every payload must specify either 'Authorization' or 'Allowed', but not both. 'Allow': Equivalent to a 'true' value for the 'Allowed' key. 'Deny': Equivalent to a 'false' value for the 'Allowed' key. 'AllowStandardUserToSetSystemService:' allows a standard (non-admin) user to configure the permissions for the specified app in the Privacy preferences for services that otherwise require admin authorization. 'AllowStandardUserToSetSystemService' is only valid for the 'ListenEvent' and 'ScreenCapture' services. Available in macOS 11 and later.
The identifier of the process receiving an AppleEvent sent by the Identifier process. This identifier is required for AppleEvents service; not valid for other services.
The type of AEReceiverIdentifier value, either 'bundleID' or 'path'. This setting is required for AppleEvents service; not valid for other services.
The code requirement for the receiving binary. This code requirement is required for AppleEvents service; not valid for other services.
Allows the application to update or delete other apps. Available in macOS 13 and later.

Keys are limited to the privacy service names listed below. Each key is an array of dictionaries describing the app or process to which access is given. In the case of conflicting specifications, the most restrictive setting (deny) will be used.
The bundle ID or installation path of the binary.
The designated requirement describing the code signature of this executable.
If set to true, statically validate the code requirement. Used only if the process invalidates its dynamic code signature.
If set to true, access is granted. Otherwise the process does not have access. The user is not prompted and cannot change this value.
